sen.j: 金色夜叉（こんじきやしゃ）は、尾崎紅葉著の明治時代の代表的な小説。
sen.e: Konjiki Yasha is a representative novel in the Meiji period written by Koyo OZAKI.
Konjiki Yasha is a representative novel of Meiji Period written by Koyo OZAKI.
sen.cmt: 「明治を代表する」という原文の意味を強調するため前置詞「in」を「of」に変更しました。また、明治時代から定冠詞「the」を削除しました。
sen.e: Konjiki Yasha is a representative novel of Meiji Period written by Koyo OZAKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 読売新聞に明治30年（1897年）1月1日～明治35年（1902年）5月11日まで連載された。
sen.e: It appeared serially in Yomiuri Shimbun from January 1, 1897 to May 11, 1902.
It appeared serially in Yomiuri shimbun-Newspaper from January 1, 1897 to May 11, 1902.
sen.cmt: 読売新聞について、その読みのみ記載されていましたので、「Newspaper」を加えました。
sen.e: It appeared serially in Yomiuri shimbun-Newspaper from January 1, 1897 to May 11, 1902.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 未完。
sen.e: Unfinished.
This piece is unfinished.
sen.cmt: 訳文はコンマが付いていますので文を意図したものと思われますが、これでは文章ではありませんので訂正しました。
sen.e: This piece is unfinished.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 昭和に入って、度々、映画、ドラマ化されるようになった。
sen.e: Since the Showa period, it has often been adapted for the movie and the drama.
Once entered in Showa period, this novel has been often adapted for movies and dramas.
sen.cmt: 1. 本稿を通じて小説タイトルを指し示す「it」などの代名詞が多用されていますが、対訳としては良くても文章全体から見ると時にわかりづらくなります。ここでは代名詞の指し示すものについて出来る限り記載する方向に訂正しています。2. 映画、ドラマ化について、原文では「度々」という説明があり、特定の映画ではありませんので、定冠詞「the」を削除し、映画・ドラマを複数形にしています。
sen.e: Once entered in Showa period, this novel has been often adapted for movies and dramas.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 追いかけて許しを乞うお宮を貫一が蹴り飛ばす、熱海での場面が有名である。
sen.e: The famous scene is that at Atami Kanichi kicked Omiya, who chased him and begged forgiveness.
There is a famous scene in this story that Kanichi gave a kicked at Omiya who came after Kanichi to Atami for his forgiveness.
sen.cmt: 直訳調で口に出して読むと読みづらくもありますし、意味が浅くなりがちですので、基本的に全文書き直しました。（訳者の問題だけでなく原文の問題でもあります）
sen.e: There is a famous scene in this story that Kanichi gave a kicked at Omiya who came after Kanichi to Atami for his forgiveness.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 第一高等学校 (旧制)の学生の間貫一（はざま かんいち）の許婚（いいなずけ）であるお宮（鴫沢宮、しぎさわ みや）は、結婚を間近にして、富豪の富山唯継のところへ嫁ぐ。
sen.e: Omiya (Miya SHIGISAWA), who was engaged to Kanichi HAZAMA, a student of Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school), got married to a millionaire, Tadatsugu TOMIYAMA, just before her wedding to Kanichi.

Although Omiya (Miya SHIGISAWA) was once engaged to a student of Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school), Kanichi HAZAMA, she suddenly got married with a wealthy Tadatsugu TOMIYAMA just before the marriage with Kanichi.
sen.cmt: 1. 原文で「富豪」のところ訳文では「millionaire」となっていますが、日本での話であり、当時アメリカでさえ「百万長者」が存在したかも不明ですので、普通の「富豪」の訳に変更しました。2. 原文も色々な内容を一文につなげて読みづらいのですが、それを直訳するとこれも読みづらいです。省略などを行い、句読点を減らす方向で訳を訂正しました。
sen.e: Although Omiya (Miya SHIGISAWA) was once engaged to a student of Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school), Kanichi HAZAMA, she suddenly got married with a wealthy Tadatsugu TOMIYAMA just before the marriage with Kanichi.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それに激怒した貫一は、熱海で宮を問い詰めるが、宮は本心を明かさない。
sen.e: Kanichi, who became infuriated by that, questioned Miya closely at Atami, but she would not tell her real feeling.
Kanichi was infuriated by the act of Omiya; he questioned her closely about the reason when she came after Kanichi to Atami, yet she did not tell him the truth.
sen.cmt: 原文で「それに激怒した」とあるためかここでも「それに」を「that」で代用していますが、記述すべきと思います。なお、お宮が宮になったりお宮になったりころころ原文で変わっていますが、特に英文表記では問題があると思いますので最初に出た「Omiya」に統一しました。
sen.e: Kanichi was infuriated by the act of Omiya; he questioned her closely about the reason when she came after Kanichi to Atami, yet she did not tell him the truth.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 貫一は宮を蹴り飛ばし、復讐のために、高利貸しになる。
sen.e: Kanichi kicked Miya, and became a usurer in order to take revenge on her.
Kanichi then gave a kick at Omiya and rejected her begging for forgiveness; Kanichi became a usurer in order to take a revenge on her.
sen.cmt: 原文が説明不足であるため直訳すると本来一文で続くはずのない文章が一緒になり、意味が唐突になります。多少の意訳を加えました。
sen.e: Kanichi then gave a kick at Omiya and rejected her begging for forgiveness; Kanichi became a usurer in order to take a revenge on her.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一方、お宮も幸せに暮らせずにいた。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Omiya did not live happily, either.
Meanwhile, Omiya could not live happily, neither.
sen.cmt: 否定文ですので、「either」を「neither」に変更しました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Omiya could not live happily, neither.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 日本語では「model」で推測可能ですが、英語ではどうでしょうか。そのため、多少説明を加えました。

sen.j: 文芸評論家北嶋廣敏によれば、主人公・間貫一のモデルは児童文学者の巖谷小波である。
sen.e: According to a literary critic, Hirotoshi KITAJIMA, the model of the main character, Kanichi HAZAMA, was Sazanami IWAYA, a scholar of children's literature.
According to a literary critic, Hirotoshi KITAJIMA, the model of the main character, Kanichi HAZAMA, was Sazanami IWAYA, a scholar of children's literature.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: According to a literary critic, Hirotoshi KITAJIMA, the model of the main character, Kanichi HAZAMA, was Sazanami IWAYA, a scholar of children's literature.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 彼には芝の高級料亭で働いていた須磨という恋人がいた。
sen.e: He had a lover named Suma, who worked for a high-class Japanese-style restaurant in Shiba.
He had a lover named Suma, who worked for a high-class Japanese-style restaurant in Shiba.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He had a lover named Suma, who worked for a high-class Japanese-style restaurant in Shiba.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: が、小波が京都の新聞社に2年間赴任している間に、博文館の大橋新太郎（富山唯継のモデル）に横取りされてしまった。
sen.e: However, while Sazanami was working for a newspaper publishing company in Kyoto for two years, Shintaro OHASHI of Hakubunkan (the model of Tadatsugu TOMIYAMA) stole her from him.
However, Shintaro OHASHI of Hakubunkan (the model of Tadatsugu TOMIYAMA) made of with Suma while Sazanami was away for two years working at a newspaper publishing company in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 原文の「赴任」の意味を表すため、「working for a newspaper-」を「working at a-」に変更しました。「her」「him」などの代名詞が続き、誰を特定しているのかわかりづらくなっていますので指示しているものを記述しました。「However」「while」などが続き不自然なため、文章の順序を変更することで対応しました。順序変更のみで内容変更がない部分を青地にてしめしています。
sen.e: However, Shintaro OHASHI of Hakubunkan (the model of Tadatsugu TOMIYAMA) made of with Suma while Sazanami was away for two years working at a newspaper publishing company in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 小波は別に結婚する気もなかったのでたいして気にも留めていなかったというが、友人の尾崎紅葉が怒って料亭に乗り込み須磨を足蹴にした。
sen.e: It is said that Sazanami did not mind that very much because he did not intend to marry her, but his friend, Koyo OZAKI got angry, burst into the restaurant, and gave Suma a kick.
It is said that Sazanami did not mind that very much because he did not intend to marry her, but his friend Koyo got angry, burst into the restaurant, and gave a kick at Suma.
sen.cmt: 「足蹴にする」の訳について、ここでは「give a kick」の用法が用いられていますが、訳文では文法的に問題があると思いますので直しました。
sen.e: It is said that Sazanami did not mind that very much because he did not intend to marry her, but his friend Koyo got angry, burst into the restaurant, and gave a kick at Suma.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 熱海の海岸のシーンはそれがヒントになったという。
sen.e: It inspired him to write the scene of the seaside in Atami.
It inspired Koyo to write the scene held at the seashore of Atami.
sen.cmt: 代名詞「him」が誰を指すかわかりづらいため、紅葉の名前を記述しました。「熱海の海岸のシーン」という部分が直訳的だったため変更しました。
sen.e: It inspired Koyo to write the scene held at the seashore of Atami.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 何の評価か、という言い方にしないと文章内ではわかりづらいと思います。

sen.j: 作者が未完のままに亡くなったため、作品の全体像が掴めないという難点はあるが、雅俗折衷の文体は当時から華麗なものとして賞賛された。
sen.e: Because the author died without completing the work, it is hard to see the perspective picture of the novel, but the compromise between the classical and colloquial styles was praised and considered splendid since then.

Because the author died before completing the work, it is hard to see the perspective picture of the novel, but the compromise between the classical and colloquial styles was praised and considered splendid.
sen.cmt: 前置詞等を多少変更しました。最後の「since them.」を削除しました。
sen.e: Because the author died before completing the work, it is hard to see the perspective picture of the novel, but the compromise between the classical and colloquial styles was praised and considered splendid.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、自然主義文学の口語文小説が一般化すると、その美文がかえって古めかしいものと思われた。
sen.e: However, after the naturalist literature in colloquial style became popular, its elegant prose came to be considered old-fashioned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, once the naturalist literature in colloquial style became popular, its elegant prose was considered as old-fashioned.
sen.cmt: 前項目同様前置詞などを多少変更しました。余分と思われる言い回しを短縮し簡略化しました。
sen.e: However, once the naturalist literature in colloquial style became popular, its elegant prose was considered as old-fashioned.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ストーリーの展開の通俗性が強調され、真剣に検討されることは少なくなった。
sen.e: The popularity in a plot development was emphasized, and it rarely came to be treated seriously.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the mediocrity of the plot development of this novel became the point of focus, this novel has been no longer treated seriously since then.
sen.cmt: 単語の使用法が辞書からの直訳調で、訳文の意味があまり良くわかりませんので、原文の意に沿って変更しました。
sen.e: Because the mediocrity of the plot development of this novel became the point of focus, this novel has been no longer treated seriously since then.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1940年頃に企画された中央公論社版の『尾崎紅葉全集』の編集過程で、創作メモが発見された。
sen.e: In the process of compiling Chuo Koronsha edition of "The Complete Works of Ozaki Koyo," which was planned around 1940, notes for creation was found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The creation notes for this novel written by Koyo were found during the process of compiling Chuo Koronsha edition of "The Complete Works of Ozaki Koyo," which was planned around 1940.
sen.cmt: 口に出すと読みづらいです。文章の順序変更などを行ないました。
sen.e: The creation notes for this novel written by Koyo were found during the process of compiling Chuo Koronsha edition of "The Complete Works of Ozaki Koyo," which was planned around 1940.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 貫一が高利貸しによって貯めた金を義のために使い切ること、宮が富山に嫁いだのには、意図があってのことだったという構想の一端が明らかにされた。
sen.e: It revealed a part of an idea, for example, Kanichi used up the money for justice that he saved by lending at high rates of interest, and there was an intention in Miya's marriage to Tomiyama.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The memos revealed a part of his ideas; for examples, Kanichi spend all the money saved up by usury for justice; there was an intention for Omiya to get married with Tomiyama.
sen.cmt: 創作メモは前項で訳者も「notes」と複数形にしていますが（前項でもnotesに対するbe動詞が「was」で間違っていましたが）この項では「It」の単数形指示代名詞になっており、訂正しました。言い回しに関していくつか訂正しました。
sen.e: The memos revealed a part of his ideas; for examples, Kanichi spend all the money saved up by usury for justice; there was an intention for Omiya to get married with Tomiyama.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、戦渦の中でこの全集が未完に終わったこともあって、再評価というほどにはならなかった。
sen.e: However, this collection of works was not finished in the disasters of war, so it was not reevaluated.
However, this collection of works edition was not completed under the disasters of war, thus the novel did not come to the point of serious re-evaluation.
sen.cmt: 代名詞「it」が何を指すかわかりづらいため、小説であると記述しました。「熱海の海岸のシーン」という部分が直訳的だったため変更しました。
sen.e: However, this collection of works edition was not completed under the disasters of war, thus the novel did not come to the point of serious re-evaluation.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1980年代になって、硯友社文学全体の再評価の中で、典拠や構想についての研究が進み、アメリカの小説にヒントを得て構想されたものであるという説が有力になった。
sen.e: In the 1980s, the whole literary works by Kenyusha were revaluated, and the study of authority and idea was advanced, then the opinion that its idea was based on the American novel became dominant.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the 1980s, the whole literary works published by Kenyu-sha Company were revaluated, and the study of the souces and ideas for those novels was developed; as the result, a theory became dominant that this novel was based on American novels.
sen.cmt: 「Kenyusha」は「Kenyu-sha Company」と訂正しました。文意を正確に伝えるため、いくつか単語を加えています。(ex. literary works "published" by)直訳的な単語用法を訂正しています。また、直訳的に響く言い回しも口語調に直し、読みやすく意味の通じやすいものに訂正しました。
sen.e: In the 1980s, the whole literary works published by Kenyu-sha Company were revaluated, and the study of the souces and ideas for those novels was developed; as the result, a theory became dominant that this novel was based on American novels.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 2000年7月、堀啓子北里大学講師 (教育)が、ミネソタ大学の図書館に所蔵されているバーサ・M・クレー (Bertha M.Clay) 『WEAKER THAN A WOMAN（女より弱きもの）』が種本であることを解明した。
sen.e: In July 2000, Keiko HORI, a Kitasato University lecturer (education), found out that a source book was "Weaker Than a Woman" by Bertha M. Clay, which was owned by University of Minnesota Library.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In July 2000, Keiko HORI, a Kitasato University lecturer (education department), found out that a source of the novel was "Weaker Than a Woman" written by Bertha M. Clay, which is owned by University of Minnesota Library.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の「教育」は、教育学部を指していると思われます。そのように書かないと意味がわかりませんので訂正しました。現在も所蔵されている書物として時制を訂正しました。
sen.e: In July 2000, Keiko HORI, a Kitasato University lecturer (education department), found out that a source of the novel was "Weaker Than a Woman" written by Bertha M. Clay, which is owned by University of Minnesota Library.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 熱海サンビーチ「お宮の松」（静岡県熱海市） 追いかけて許しを乞うお宮を貫一が下駄で蹴り飛ばす場面が銅像になっている。
sen.e: Atami Sun Beach 'Omiya no matsu' (a pine tree of Omiya) (Atami City, Shizuoka Prefecture) is a bronze statue of Omiya chasing Kanichi and begging forgiveness and Kanichi kicking her with his geta (Japanese footwear).

Atami Sun Beach 'Omiya no matsu' (a pine tree of Omiya) (Atami City, Shizuoka Prefecture) is a bronze statue depicting the scene of the novel, when Omiya came after Kanichi for begging forgiveness, and consequently Kanichi gave a kick at her with his geta (Japanese footwear).
sen.cmt: ここでの追いかけるは「chase」では意味合いが別のものを差してしまう可能性がありますので、先述のように「came after」としました。多少意味が通じやすいよう加筆修正を行ないました。
sen.e: Atami Sun Beach 'Omiya no matsu' (a pine tree of Omiya) (Atami City, Shizuoka Prefecture) is a bronze statue depicting the scene of the novel, when Omiya came after Kanichi for begging forgiveness, and consequently Kanichi gave a kick at her with his geta (Japanese footwear).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
